instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-02773: What is 820-02773? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message:
Board got liquid damage near UC710 and UC300 no shorts found.

When I plug charger I get 5V 0.050A and I can hear a clicking noise coming from <CHIP>U8100</CHIP>.

PPBUS is 12.3V 

<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_MPMU_ISNS_VIN</SIGNAL> is cycling around 1.7V to 0.5V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message: If diode mode readings at LDOs and <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> coils are good, then need to change the PMU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message:
[ATTACH]61235[/ATTACH]

Do you think that pad could be a problem? it's <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> pad 136 <SIGNAL>MPMU_AMUX_BY</SIGNAL> 

Also Caps nearby <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> need to be all present? I lost <CAPACITOR>C8167</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C8169</CAPACITOR> <CAPACITOR>C8183</CAPACITOR> :(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message:
"it's <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> pad 136 [U]<SIGNAL>MPMU_AMUX_BY</SIGNAL>[/U]"
In boardview, that is pad 143.

I see many more empty pads in the picture.
I'm pretty sure not all are "NC".
In the center I see one pad covered by another pad also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message:
Thank you. They are all NC according to boardview. The pad I was referring is the one in the center
[ATTACH]61236[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V ticking and power cycle
threads.message: DAMN, this is not my post, I was reffering to my problem on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02773</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. I'm really sorry about that
